name: Crunchy Spinach Dip with Hearts of Palm
author: Jamie Justice Yost
summary: Necessity is the mother of invention - and this recipe! After discovering that we didn't have the ingredients for our original Thanksgiving appetizer, we created this out of the ingredients we did have. Now we have a new holiday favorite and a great dip to take to parties and tailgates! Serve with pita chips.
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can hearts of palm, drained and sliced
1 (5 ounce) can water chestnuts, rinsed and chopped
1 ½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese (such as Sargento® Traditional Cut)
¼ cup shredded Parmesan cheese (such as Sargento® Artisan Blends)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine spinach, garlic, salt, and pepper in skillet; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant and spinach is warmed through, about 5 minutes
Combine hearts of palm, cream cheese, sour cream, water chestnuts, and half of the mozzarella cheese together in a separate bowl
Add spinach mixture and stir to distribute ingredients evenly
Pour mixture into prepared baking dish; top with remaining mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese
Bake in preheated oven until golden and bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes
